message: Just got a small but very heavy upgrade in the mail :) can't wait for the electricity to cut now lol

data.message: I was just thinking of getting one. How much does it cost? How much time does it gives you before it run out?

Well it depends how much watts/vA you'll connect to it. A 1000vA (if not lower) will suffice for most desktops. this is the 1500va version. I should be getting about 20-40 mins of operation after it cuts, depending on load. What i noticed so far is that my electricity suffers constant voltage drops almost every 30 mins.
Thanks for your feedback. Any idea about the cost?
i got it from jumia, it was the lowest price i could find online. Its for 3.4k. but you can get 1500va for as low as ~1.8k with lesser features

Volt Ampere? That basically means Watt :)
hmm... which doesn't make much sense, I would expect the capacity of something like that to be measured in Coulombs (or Ampere-Hour) or maybe Joules (or Watt-Hour)

yes I wanted to make sure it's watt :D
I need 1000 watt, I guess I'll check jumia isA :D
Hassan Aly Selim You just want to know the load it can support. Does the time it can work offline varies a lot from model to model?

Nope its not the same...  There is an efficiency variable  missing...  Industry standard is 70% so to find the wattage it supports.  For example  1000va equals to 1000x0.7= 700watts  and so forth.  Va is not equal watt in this case

:'(
In this case I will need 1500, but with lesser features :P
Thanks man :D You motivated me to take this step :D
any advice for what to consider when buying it? :D
Go for it haha it took me a lot of time to warrant the cost and buy one too..  But with electricity cuts these days its a good time for it..

First electricity cut :) Happy to announce my Desktop went the full hour on battery no problem, till the power came back! Now the next step is maintaining internet connection and my 5.1 surround...then nerdgasm achieved lol

any way to hook up a moshtarak to this thing ?
dude ... you need to give it a try and let us know :P

haha for sure, ill figure it out, there is already a bit of surplus i can still use, i'm barely at half load most of the time. Problem is it only takes an AC power cable extensions.. the female part! Soo gotta research that shit and see if its even possible
